sn45.3:4.2: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha,
sn45.3:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn45.3:4.5: “Sir, good friends, companions, and associates are the whole of the spiritual life.
sn45.3:5.2: Good friends, companions, and associates are the whole of the spiritual life.
sn45.3:5.4: A mendicant with good friends, companions, and associates can expect to
sn45.3:5.5: develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.3:5.6: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.3:6.1: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.3:6.2: and right samādhi, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn45.3:6.3: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.
sn45.3:7.1: And here’s another way to understand how good friends are the whole of the spiritual life.
sn45.3:7.3: For, by relying on me as a good friend, sentient beings who are liable to rebirth, old age, and death, to sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress are freed from all these things.
sn45.3:7.7: This is another way to understand how good friends are the whole of the spiritual life.”
